bibl.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to William Hunter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: Second Assistant U.S. Secretary of State

div1.p:
United States Consulate at Monrovia
to the Department of State

M. A. Aenmey to the
Honle Second Assistant Secretary of State
Death of the Honl Henry Highland Garnet. United States Minister Resident and Consul General to Liberia

To the
Honble Second Assistant Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
It becomes my painfull duty to advise you of the death of the Honl Henry Highland Garnet. United States Minister Resident and Consul General to Liberia.
He departed this life at 4.15. P.M. on the 13th of February, at his residence in this City, from the effects of Astma The funeral will take place to day at 2 o'clock P.M.
From the Executive Mansion and from all the foreign Consulates the flags have been half masted.

with sentiments of
the highest esteem
I am Sir
Your obedient Servant
M. A. Aenmey
U.S. Vice Consul General.
